oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Jesse Lee - 2017-12-17
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Jesse Lee from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 17, 2017. Includes questions for the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jesse Lee;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and songwriter introduction by Abi Tapia / (03:00) Opening comments from Jesse and tells story about co-writing with Brett Young and introduces the next song / (5:00) Performs Like I Loved You / (08:44) Introduces the next song / (09:50) Performs We'd Be Stupid Not To / (12:56) Introduces the next song / (14:31) Performs That Could Still Be Us / (18:17) Answers question about songwriter royalties and payments from streaming / (20:38) Answers question about songwriter royalties / (21:36) Answers question about getting songs to artists / (22:49) Answers question about her inspiration / (23:36) Answers question about her musical background / (24:32) Introduces the next song / (25:14) Performs Hotel / (28:27) Answers question about streaming services / (29:10) Answers question about record deal partnerships / (30:10) Introduces the next song / (31:15) Performs Summer Like You / (35:33) Answers question about how many songs she's written /

(36:20) Answers question about her favorite songs / (37:00) Answers question about words or music coming first / (38:04) Answers question about ever being surprised as to who recorded a song of hers / (38:14) Tells the story of writing the song Feels Like Christmas / (40:35) Introduces the next song / (41:37) Performs Peter Pan / (44:49) Final comments / (44:59) Walk-out music / (47:01) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Lee, Jesse; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
